text.*:
People's Republic of Bangladesh
Ministry of Education
Bengali: শিক্ষা মন্ত্রণালয়
(Śikṣā Montronaloya)
Government Seal of Bangladesh
Agency overview
Formed 1971
Jurisdiction Government of Bangladesh
Headquarters Ministry of Education
Dhaka-1000, Bangladesh.
Agency executives
  • Nurul Islam Nahid , Minister of Education
  • Dr. Kamal Abdul Naser Chowdhury, Secretary of Ministry of Education
Website http://www.moedu.gov.bd

The Ministry of Education (Bengali: শিক্ষা মন্ত্রণালয়) (abbreviated as MoED) is the ministry responsible for secondary, vocational and tertiary education in Bangladesh. Primary education and mass literacy is the responsibility of the Ministry of Primary and Mass Education (MoPME). The Ministry of Education contains two divisions:[1][2]

  • Secondary and Higher Education Division
  • Technical and Madrasah Education Division

Contents

  • 1 Ministers
  • 2 Departments
    • 2.1 Secondary and Higher Education Division
    • 2.2 Technical and Madrassah Education Division
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

Ministers[edit]

  • Current Minister : Nurul Islam Nahid
  • Current State Minister of Technical and Madrasah Education Division : Kazi Keramat Ali
  • January 16, 2007-December 26, 2007 : Ayub Quadri[3][4]

  • Intermediate and Secondary Education, Chittagong
  • Intermediate and Secondary Education, Sylhet
  • International Mother Language Institute

  • National Curriculum and Textbook Board

  • Department of Inspection and Audit
  • Bangladesh National Commission of UNESCO
  • Bangladesh Bureau of Educational Information and Statistics (BANBEIS)
  • University Grants Commission (Bangladesh)
  • Private Teachers Registration and Certification Authority
  • Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board, Bangladesh
  • Intermediate and Secondary Education, Dhaka
  • Department of Secondary and Higher Education
  • Education Engineering Department
  • Comilla Education Board

  • Rajshahi Education Board

Technical and Madrassah Education Division[edit]

  • Bangladesh Technical Education Board
  • Bangladesh Madrasa Education Board
  • Bangladesh Sanskrit and Pali Education Board
  • National Training and Research Academy for Multilingual Shorthand
  • Directorate of Technical Education

  3. ^ UNB, Dhaka (2007-01-16). ", tanvir ahammed abroad: 3 more Advisers take oath". The New Nation. Retrieved 2007-12-31. [dead link]
  4. ^ "Bangladesh adviser quits over artifact theft". REUTERS. 2007-12-26. USDHA30728920071226. Retrieved 2007-12-31.
